oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Managing liability risk with student externs and volunteers
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ellis, Linda
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: student externs
volunteers
liability
insurance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Providing practice and clinical experience and exposure for veterinary students and externs, and other students interested in a career in veterinary medicine, is a longstanding tradition in veterinary practice. This provides the much-needed oppor足tunities for those wanting to become veterinarians or those currently in veterinary school. There will always be risks work足ing with animals, including risks of a student or volunteer get足ting injured or making a mistake that leads to injury or loss of a patient. It is important to review best practices and insurance coverages before hosting students and volunteers to help pro足tect the practice and students and provide a safe and productive experience for all involved.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 55 (2022): 2022 Annual Conference Proceedings; 10
